Package ohos.media.camera.device

Interface FrameConfig


  • public interface FrameConfig
    An interface for configuring frame capture, image processing, and image output.
    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#CAMERA

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  FrameConfig.Builder
      Provides frame configuration Builder objects.

      • getSurfaces

        List<Surface> getSurfaces​()
        Gets all surfaces configured for the current frame capture.
        Returns:
        Returns all surfaces configured; returns a list with the length of 0 if no surface is configured.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        FrameConfig.Builder.addSurface(Surface)

      • getAwbMode

        int getAwbMode​()
        Gets the auto white balance (AWB) mode set for the current frame capture.
        Returns:
        Returns the AWB mode that has been set; returns the default value Metadata.AwbMode#AWB_AUTOMATIC if the AWB mode is not set.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        Metadata.AwbMode, FrameConfig.Builder.setAwbMode(int, Rect)

      • getMark

        Object getMark​()
        Obtains the unique mark on a FrameConfig instance.

        The mark is used to identify a FrameConfig instance during frame processing by the camera.

        Returns:
        Returns the unique FrameConfig mark.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        FrameStateCallback.onFrameStarted(Camera, FrameConfig, long, long), FrameStateCallback.onFrameProgressed(Camera, FrameConfig, FrameResult), FrameStateCallback.onFrameFinished(Camera, FrameConfig, FrameResult), FrameStateCallback.onFrameError(Camera, FrameConfig, int, FrameResult), FrameConfig.Builder.setMark(Object)

      • equals

        boolean equals​(Object obj)
        Checks whether this FrameConfig object equals a specified object.

        The two objects are equal only when all their elements are the same.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Indicates the specified object to compare.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the two objects are equal; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        Object.hashCode(), HashMap
